verses.kjv: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, unto the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints which are in all Achaia:
verses.ct: From Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by God's will, and from our brother Timothy — to God's church in Corinth, along with all of God's people throughout Achaia:

verses.kjv: Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: May grace and peace be yours from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: Blessed be God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;
verses.ct: Praise be to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ! He is the Father of mercy and the God of all comfort.

verses.kjv: Who comforteth us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to comfort them which are in any trouble, by the comfort wherewith we ourselves are comforted of God.
verses.ct: He comforts us through every hardship we face, so that we can comfort others in whatever trouble they experience, using the same comfort God has given us.

verses.kjv: For as the sufferings of Christ abound in us, so our consolation also aboundeth by Christ.
verses.ct: Just as we share abundantly in the sufferings of Christ, so through Christ our comfort overflows as well.

verses.kjv: And whether we be afflicted, it is for your consolation and salvation, which is effectual in the enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer: or whether we be comforted, it is for your consolation and salvation.
verses.ct: When we go through suffering, it produces comfort and salvation for you — comfort that works effectively as you endure the same kinds of suffering we endure. When we receive comfort, that also results in your comfort and salvation.

verses.kjv: And our hope of you is stedfast, knowing, that as ye are partakers of the sufferings, so shall ye be also of the consolation.
verses.ct: Our confidence in you remains firm, because we know that just as you share in our sufferings, you will also share in our comfort.

verses.kjv: For we would not, brethren, have you ignorant of our trouble which came to us in Asia, that we were pressed out of measure, above strength, insomuch that we despaired even of life:
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, we don't want you to be unaware of the hardship we experienced in Asia. We were crushed far beyond what we could handle — so much that we even lost hope of surviving.

verses.kjv: But we had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God which raiseth the dead:
verses.ct: In fact, we felt like we had received a death sentence. But this happened so that we would not rely on ourselves but on God, who raises the dead.

verses.kjv: Who delivered us from so great a death, and doth deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliver us;
verses.ct: He rescued us from such a deadly threat, and he continues to rescue us. We have placed our hope in him that he will rescue us again,

verses.kjv: Ye also helping together by prayer for us, that for the gift bestowed upon us by the means of many persons thanks may be given by many on our behalf.
verses.ct: as you also join in helping us through your prayers. Then many people will give thanks on our behalf for the gracious gift given to us through the prayers of so many.

verses.kjv: For our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and godly sincerity, not with fleshly wisdom, but by the grace of God, we have had our conversation in the world, and more abundantly to you-ward.
verses.ct: Here is what we take pride in: our conscience confirms that we have conducted ourselves in the world — and especially toward you — with the holiness and sincerity that come from God, not relying on human cleverness but on God's grace.

verses.kjv: For we write none other things unto you, than what ye read or acknowledge; and I trust ye shall acknowledge even to the end;
verses.ct: We aren't writing anything to you that you can't read and understand. I'm confident that you will fully understand,

verses.kjv: As also ye have acknowledged us in part, that we are your rejoicing, even as ye also are ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.
verses.ct: just as you have already partially understood, that we are your source of pride just as you are ours on the day of the Lord Jesus.

verses.kjv: And in this confidence I was minded to come unto you before, that ye might have a second benefit;
verses.ct: With this confidence, I originally planned to visit you first so that you could benefit from a second visit.

verses.kjv: And to pass by you into Macedonia, and to come again out of Macedonia unto you, and of you to be brought on my way toward Judaea.
verses.ct: My plan was to stop with you on my way to Macedonia, then come back to you from Macedonia, and have you send me on my way to Judea.

verses.kjv: When I therefore was thus minded, did I use lightness? or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be yea yea, and nay nay?
verses.ct: So when I made these plans, was I being careless about it? Do I make my plans based on human impulses, saying 'yes, yes' and 'no, no' at the same time?

verses.kjv: But as God is true, our word toward you was not yea and nay.
verses.ct: As surely as God is faithful, our message to you has not been 'yes' and 'no' simultaneously.

verses.kjv: For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, even by me and Silvanus and Timotheus, was not yea and nay, but in him was yea.
verses.ct: The Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was proclaimed among you by us — by me, Silvanus, and Timothy — was never 'yes' and 'no.' In him it has always been 'yes.'

verses.kjv: For all the promises of God in him are yea, and in him Amen, unto the glory of God by us.
verses.ct: Every single promise God has made finds its 'yes' in him. That is why through him we say 'Amen' to the glory of God.

verses.kjv: Now he which stablisheth us with you in Christ, and hath anointed us, is God;
verses.ct: Now it is God who strengthens both us and you in our connection to Christ, and who has anointed us.

verses.kjv: Who hath also sealed us, and given the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts.
verses.ct: He has also placed his seal of ownership on us and put his Spirit in our hearts as a guarantee of what is to come.

verses.kjv: Moreover I call God for a record upon my soul, that to spare you I came not as yet unto Corinth.
verses.ct: I call on God as my witness — I stake my soul on it — that the reason I haven't come to Corinth yet was to spare you.

verses.kjv: Not for that we have dominion over your faith, but are helpers of your joy: for by faith ye stand.
verses.ct: It's not that we lord it over your faith. Instead, we work alongside you for your joy, because you stand firm through faith.
